Georgia Department of Education
September 10 at 3:30 PM ·

In keeping with Senate Bill 367, which was signed into law in July, Georgia has eliminated half of the Georgia Milestones End-of-Course tests required of high school students.

Georgia has now seen the largest reduction in standardized testing in state history, going from 32 state-required assessments in 2015 to 19 beginning this school year. SB 367 also removed the fifth-grade social studies Georgia Milestones assessment, reducing Georgia elementary-school testing to the federal minimum.

Learn more: https://www.gadoe.org/External-Affairs-and-Policy/communications/Pages/PressReleaseDetails.aspx?PressView=default&pid=802

September 3, 2020

Monroe County Schools and the Mary Persons High School Athletics Department have today temporarily suspended the school's softball program due to a participant testing positive for Covid-19. This shut down includes scheduled team practice and games.

Under the Georgia High School Association (GHSA) and Department of Public Health guidance, student athletes, coaches, and others involved in team activities are being advised to self-quarantine for a period of time. The softball team activities are tentatively scheduled to resume on Thursday, Sept. 17.

"We are closely following the guidance of the GHSA and our local and regional public health officials," said Dr. Mike Hickman, Superintendent of Schools. "Our first and primary goal is to maintain the well-being of our students and our staff, along with their families."

Just a reminder this event takes place on Wednesday!

The Monroe County Sheriff's Office and Tommy Campbell's Collision Center are partnering with Rescue Mission to bring much needed food to our communities.

The Farmers to Families Food Box Program is a government sponsored program in response to COVID-19 and is also sponsored by the USDA & Dept. of Faith Based Initiatives.

Food will be available at different locations around Monroe County for pick up every Wednesday from July 8th - August 5th. Each location will be a "drive through, no-contact" pick-up, and 500 boxes will be given out.

Please note only 1 (one) box will be given per vehicle. Each box contains enough food for 1 - 2 meals and a gallon of milk.

Monroe County's next food pick-up will be Wednesday, July 15th 11:30 to 1:30 pm at Ellis Field, 39 College Street, Culloden.
#nochildhungry #partnersineducation
#differencemakers

H/T Gwendolyn Byrd

Monroe County Fine Arts Center
May 22 at 1:26 AM ·

The Monroe County Fine Arts Center is missing its wonderful patrons and all the talented student and visiting performers. While we "socially distance" ourselves, let's revisit some of the fun we've had over the past three years.

Tonight's picture honors the theater and choral students of the MPHS Class of 2020. The Fine Arts Center has been the backdrop for many senior pictures during the past few weeks. Tonight, five Mary Persons High School seniors and three moms were having a photo shoot just before sundown -- a scene which made us at the same time happy and a little bit sad. One of the Moms said the girls (all chorus and/or theater students) had come to take pictures at the FAC which had become their "second home" during the past three years. Tomorrow night, they will be among the Class of 2020 Reverse Parade taking place between the MP building and the FAC. We will miss these girls -- and their talented classmates -- who have given us much joy as they have sung, danced and performed for us. Here's wishing each of you only the best that life has to give.

March 14 at 12:01 PM ·

URGENT REQUEST!
Our Backpack Buddies Program in Monroe County Schools helps provide supplemental food for students in need over the weekend. Many of these students rely on nourishment during the school day from our school meals. Since school is not in session this coming week we are going to do our best to continue to provide food for our students who need it. If you would like to donate the following items to this cause, we would greatly appreciate your support!

Peanut butter/jelly
Fruit cups/applesauce pouches
Individually packaged cereals, granola bars, crackers, chips
Canned fruit, veggies, meats, soups, meals (that can be opened without a can opener)
Juice boxes
Bottled water
Instant oatmeal, grits
Ramen noodles
Paper products

All food and Monetary donations/gift cards can be delivered to the Monroe County BOE to the attention of Gwen Byrd. Monetary donations and gift cards will be used to purchase perishable items like milk, hot dogs, bread, lunch meat, cheese, etc.

Here’s the link for monetary donations online!

From Monroe County Achievement Center Principal Grady Caldwell: After consulting with local and state health care agencies concerning the COVID-19 virus, we have decided to postpone the 6th Annual Fit to Achieve 5K. The safety of our participants and community will always be our top priority. As we gather more information, we will schedule a date later this spring to have our 5K. The Fit to Achieve 5K has been our largest fundraiser over the years, and our students benefit greatly from the proceeds. It is my hope that you understand this and remain patient with us as we schedule a new date for the 5K race.

In the interim, all refunds will be honored upon request. We apologize for any inconvenience! But we decided to "play it safe" instead of "run a race". #fittoachieve #committedtoexcellence #learngrowsucceed
